Posts.Content: Jun 19, 2012 08:43PM positivenergy wrote: Thanks so much for your reply GrandmaV I appreciate it.  I think after i freaked out for a bit I realized that they are doing what is best for me.  I look forward to talking more.  Thank you again.  Hugs back.  Can I be nosey and ask what IDC is and what Grade 3 means?
Posts.Title: Overwhelmed Lettiegonz LittleMelons

Posts.Content: Jun 19, 2012 01:11PM positivenergy wrote: I am in the same boat.  Diagnosised 6/12.  I am feeling blessed as I found a very small lump .5; told my doctor, she ordered a diagnostic mamo right away, they saw nothing.  Did an ultrasound and found something questionable.  Ordered a biopsy and it came back as DCIStu (???) not sure of the lingo.  Anyway, surgeon says I have ER - positive and PR - negative, says it is very few, but still not looking at hormone therapy.  Surgeon suggested that my best choice would be a lumpectomy and six weeks of radiation, but I should think about it for a few days.  They schedule me for the oncology radiologist for this Thursday 6/21 and the surgeon 6/22 to make my decision and schedule surgery.  Been through tons of feelings and planning to have people off to be with me, since I did not have anyone with me for the diagnosis :)  They call today to say, after a team meeting the radiologist does not feel comfortable making a treatment recommendation without an MRI and everything is on hold again until they get approval from the insurance company.  I started crying and kind of freaked out.  I actually had to go and take a nap in my car at work.  Can anyone shed any light on what to think about all this?
Posts.Title: Overwhelmed Lettiegonz LittleMelons
